newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Telecom head defers media briefings.
newsitem.headline: HK Telecom head defers media briefings.

text.p: Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd chief executive Linus Cheung postponed a series of media briefings on Friday, the same day trading in shares of Hongkong Telecom and CITIC Pacific was suspended.
A spokeswoman for Hongkong Telecom said she did not know whether the postponement was related to the trading suspension.
Cheung was due to meet journalists later on Friday in one-on-one interviews following Thursday's announcement that the company posted a 12.5 percent rise in net annual profit to HK$11.18 billion.
The spokeswoman said Hongkong Telecom may issue a statement later in the day on the trading suspension.
"We have nothing to say at this moment. We are trying to get more information," she said.
The Hong Kong stock exchange said trading in the shares of CITIC Pacific, which holds eight percent of the utility, and Hongkong Telecom had been suspended at their own request.
Speculation has mounted recently of a mainland investor taking a stake in Hongkong Telecom.
